title: 108_hr2504
content: The Act titled "Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003" allows for the refinancing of existing consolidation loans. The Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003 allows borrowers to refinance existing consolidation loans at a variable interest rate, excluding loans used solely to repay certain types of loans. The Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003 allows borrowers to refinance existing consolidation loans under the Federal Direct Consolidation Loans program. The Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003 allows borrowers to refinance existing consolidation loans under the Federal Direct Consolidation Loans program, including the availability of variable interest rate consolidation loans. The Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003 allows borrowers to refinance existing consolidation loans under the Federal Direct Consolidation Loans program, including variable interest rate consolidation loans with rates determined annually based on Treasury bill auctions. The Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003 allows borrowers to refinance existing consolidation loans under the Federal Direct Consolidation Loans program. The interest rate for these loans is determined annually based on Treasury bill auctions, with a maximum rate of 8.25 percent. Excess interest above the special allowance rate is credited back to the Government. The Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003 allows borrowers to refinance existing consolidation loans under the Federal Direct Consolidation Loans program. The interest rate for these loans is determined annually based on Treasury bill auctions, with a maximum rate of 8.25 percent. Excess interest above the special allowance rate is credited back to the Government. The amount of adjustment of interest on a loan under this subsection is calculated based on the applicable interest rate minus the special allowance rate, multiplied by the average daily principal balance of the loan during the quarter, divided by four. This provision does not apply to consolidation loans used to repay loans made under section 428B or Federal Direct PLUS Loans. The Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003 allows borrowers to refinance existing consolidation loans under the Federal Direct Consolidation Loans program. The interest rate for these loans is determined annually based on Treasury bill auctions, with a maximum rate of 8.25 percent. Excess interest above the special allowance rate is credited back to the Government. The Act also introduces variable interest rate consolidation loans for loans disbursed after a certain date. The interest rate for consolidation loans under the Student Loan Fairness Consolidation Act of 2003 is determined annually based on Treasury bill auctions, with a maximum rate of 8.25 percent. This rate is calculated by adding the bond equivalent rate of 91-day Treasury bills auctioned at the final auction held prior to June 1, plus 2.3 percent. This provision does not apply to consolidation loans used exclusively to repay certain types of loans. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to section 438(b)(2)(I) by including section 427A(m).
